review: If you are an Amazon Prime Member you must have one of these on your tv.  The Prime instant video experience is unmatched.  I love mine.

review: The Fire TV Stick works as advertised, so no issues with that. My issue is that I pre-ordered the thing, but it was available in Best Buy stores for nearly the same price a full month before mine shipped.
author: Amazon Customer

review: It makes everything very easy to access and pretty true HD.  The one thing I have trouble with occasionally is it disconnects from my internet.  The only way I seem to get it to work again is remove the stick from the tv and re plug in.

review: I am loving it so far. I think it is a hands down winner vs my Roku (which is no slouch either)
author: John in O Town

review: I got this when it went on sale for $20 as a backup to my computer system which is connected to my TV. Pretty cool little device, lots of great features, and even at $39 it is a good dea.
author: Michael Harrington "msharrington315"

review: Excellent product... I will buy a couple more for my kids...
author: Amazon Customer

review: Works as it should and for the initial Prime offering price is very nice.  There is an adapter if you need to get it into an HDMI slot with cramped access.  The problem is that adapter causes problems.  With it, I couldn't connect to accept my LAN's security.  Without the adapter, it worked perfectly.  Let's remember though, the basis of these things is that you have to pay for service from a source, like Netflix or Hulu plus, etc.  If you have Prime, you can get some of their limited media, but very often, they have the first year of a show for free, but not the second, or something like that.
author: GG "gg reviews"

review: Plugged it in as directed and everything works great
